clinical_study.official_title: Divided Drug Delivery : a Way to Prevent Repeated Volutary Drug Intoxications.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy of an advice with a weekly divided drug delivery, compared to an usual monthly delivery in the prevention of voluntary drug intoxications repeated.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the efficacy of an advice with a weekly divided drug delivery, compared to an usual monthly delivery in the prevention of voluntary drug intoxications repeated
primary_outcome.description: Number of cumulative voluntary drug intoxications throughout the 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women between 18 and 65 years.
- Hospitalized after a voluntary drug intoxication.
- History of two voluntary drug intoxications at least.
- Person registered for social security.
- Signed free consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under treatment for opiate split
- Acute or chronicgoing wild.
- Cognitive problems hindering understanding of questionnaires
- Persons targeted by articles L1121-5 to L1121-8 of CSP
